alert.note: Alert for Sherman; Wallace (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 11:33PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Wallace and southwestern Sherman Counties through 1100 PM MDT... At 1033 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles south of Ruleton, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Wallace and southwestern Sherman Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM MDT for east central Colorado...and northwestern and west central Kansas.
